Name: Dulcimer
ShortText: Dulcimer becomes the first widely used stringed musical instrument
Text: Hammered dulcimer becomes the first widely used stringed musical instrument, and was a first precursor of Piano. Its structure of paired strings was very similar to one of piano. It was used in Middle East, Southwest Asia, China, Greece and Rome.

Name: Clavichord
ShortText: Invention of clavichord by Giovanni Spinette
Text: Invention of clavichord by the Italian musician and luthier Giovanni Spinette. Wooden form of clavichord will later be adapted into piano.

Name: Harpsichord
ShortText: First harpsichord with four octaves
Text: Italian inventor Hieronymus Bononiensis created first harpsichord with four octaves. This instrument was recorded to have very weak sound and was used rarely.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: Birth of first instrument that we would today call a piano, pianoforte
Text: Birth of first instrument that we would today call a piano. This invention was made by Italian Bartolomeo Cristofori, who named this instrument pianoforte. Relatively cheap price enabled this piano to become first instrument of its type to be widely adopted in homes of Italian nobility and royalty.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: First large-scale manufacture of sturdy and lightweight pianos
Text: English engineer and musician Johann Zumpe begins first large-scale manufacture of sturdy and lightweight pianos in England.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: Design of piano was expanded greatly adding more octaves
Text: Johann Zumpe design of piano was expanded greatly by English inventor John Broadwood, who added more octaves to cover treble and bass, added pedal and strings were much more robust and lauder.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: Ludwig von Beethoven created Moonlight Sonata
Text: Famous classical music composer Ludwig von Beethoven created Moonlight Sonata, one of the most popular piano compositions of all time. (Music found in Grand Piano music example.)

Name: Cabinet piano
ShortText: Piano got a new shape of a tall box, a Cabinet piano
Text: Piano got a new shape of a tall box, a Cabinet piano.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: First piano with agraffe, which enabled much more aggressive use of keyboards and hammers
Text: Inventor Stbastien Erad created first piano with agraffe, which enabled much more aggressive use of keyboards and hammers. This gave ability to famous classical composers such as Beethoven, Mozart, and Liszt to create their most famous works.

Name: Modern upright piano
ShortText: First upright piano was made
Text: First upright piano was made. This design achieved phenomenal popularity.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: Pianoforte name shortened into much more manageable piano
Text: Pianoforte instruments finally got their name shortened into much more manageable piano.

Name: Grand Piano
ShortText: Grand pianos started being made in America
Text: Grand pianos started being made in America. Their bodies were created from one-cast iron frame. This design will be popularized by the manufacturer Steinway.

Name: Fortepiano (horizontal)
ShortText: Foundation of the Steinway piano company
Text: Foundation of the Steinway piano company. Regarded as one of the best piano company of all time, it still functions to this day.

Name: Grand Piano
ShortText: Manhattan's Steinway Music Hall was built to house New York Philharmonic orchestra
Text: Manhattan's Steinway Music Hall with 2000 seating places was built to house New York Philharmonic orchestra.

Name: Grand Piano
ShortText: Foundation of Carnegie Hall, one of the most famous musical buildings in the world
Text: Foundation of Carnegie Hall, one of the most famous musical buildings in the world.

Name: Player Piano
ShortText: Automatic pianos become very popular
Text: Automatic pianos become very popular. Their use was almost non-existent after invention of radio.

Name: Modern upright piano
ShortText: Upright pianos became much smaller
Text: Upright pianos became much smaller.

Name: Electric Piano
ShortText: Invention of first electric keyboard
Text: Invention of first electric keyboard in France. Their size and complexity prevented them to become popular all until 1980s.

Name: Electric Piano
ShortText: Musical Keyboard was invented by Christopher Donison
Text: Musical Keyboard was invented by Christopher Donison, this model was used as a great learning tool.

Name: Electric Piano
ShortText: Electric keyboards started being made in all shapes and sizes
Text: Electric keyboards started being made in all shapes and sizes. Popularization of pop and electric music popularized them greatly.

Name: Electric Piano
ShortText: Electric pianos can be found in almost every band
Text: Electric pianos can be found everywhere, in almost every band.
